_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The owners, management and employees of The DeLong Co. Inc. are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If a   facility is prepared to work with the local fire department or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.
FACILITY INFORMATION  
The DeLong Co. is a member of the Fertilizer 100.  Meaning they are one of the largest 100 fertilizer dealers in the nation and one of the biggest in Wisconsin. They employ more than 85 company wide.  There are actually 5  divisions in The DeLong Co. Inc. Chick DeLong is in charge of feed. Bo DeLong is in charge of grain. Dan DeLong is in charge of DeLco Transport. Steve Quade is in charge of the seed division. David DeLong, President, is in charge of
fertilizer and chemicals. The primary activity at the facility is the storage, distribution and application of anhydrous ammonia for stateline area farmers. The maximum quantity stored would be the unloading of a  tank car holding 150,000 lbs.

WORST-CASE

The worst-case release scenario would be the release of the total contents of a storage tank or tank car released as a gas over 10 minutes. The maximum quantity released  would be 150,000 pounds which represents the volume of the largest storage tank at 85 per cent of capacity as  limited by design standards.  The distance to the endpoint (point of dispersion to 200 ppm) is 1.1 miles.

ALTERNATIVE-CASE

The alternative release scenario is based on the five-year accident history or the most likely potential incident is  release from a break in a transfer hose. The distance to the endpoint (point of dispersion to 200 ppm) is 0.41 miles.

PREVENTION PROGRAM

The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements" for the storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia K-6 1.1 published by the American National Standards institute Inc. and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) 29 CFR 1

010.I 11 storage and handing of anhydrous ammonia and the company random safety spot check.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT  HISTORY

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths injuries or significant property damage at the facility nor to our knowledge have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage or environmental damage.


EMERGENCY RESPONSE

The company has it's emergency response unit and team ready for any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia plus a written emergency action plan in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 191 Q.38.

We provide state and local authorities the emergency planning and community sight-to-know information as required under Sara Title III EPCRA and a written emergency response program in accordance with OSHA standard 29CFR 1910.120 including pre-emergency planning and employee training.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Safety improvement is an on going process at The DeLong Company.  Periodic evaluations are performed to access the maintenance and safety conditions. There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
